personalInfo.name: Sri Ramya Panja
personalInfo.title: Health Informatics Graduate & Licensed Dental Professional

summary: Health Informatics graduate and licensed dental professional with hands-on experience in clinical workflows, radiology, and public health research. Skilled in managing electronic medical records, coordinating patient referrals across dental departments, and analyzing population-based data in public health projects. Experienced in data collection, cleaning, and analysis using SQL, Python, and R, with working knowledge of Excel, Power BI, and REDCap. Integrates clinical insight with informatics skills to support research on health information exchange, workflow optimization, and quality improvement in healthcare delivery.

experience.title: Clinical Data Analyst Intern
experience.location: Denham Court, New South Wales, Australia (Remote)
description: Led full-stack development of an AI-integrated Electronic Medical Record (EMR) system using React.js, Node.js, and MySQL to enhance clinical decision support and workflow automation
Engineered and normalized relational database schema and optimized SQL operations in DBeaver, improving data reliability and query performance across patient records
Developed dynamic front-end modules for patient registration, diagnostics, and treatment management, streamlining data entry and reducing documentation errors

experience.title: Research Assistant
experience.company: Luddy School of Informatics and Computing, Indiana University
description: Managed REDCap data collection and behavioral health research datasets; supported research informatics systems including OpenClinica
Performed data cleaning, SQL queries, and statistical analysis in Python and R; documented methods using GitHub and BookStack platforms
Ensured HIPAA and IRB compliance and implemented FAIR data management standards for multi-source research data
Collaborated with informatics faculty and analysts to optimize data collection, integration, and reporting processes

experience.title: Junior Dentist / Clinical Coordinator
description: Maintained accurate EMR documentation using OpenEMR and Epic and standardized clinical records for over 1,000 patients
Led public health data collection initiatives and performed population-level analysis that informed quality improvement and research efforts
Enhanced clinical workflow coordination and data continuity across departments through process mapping and validation checklists

education.institution: Drs. Sudha & Nageswara Rao Siddhartha Institute of Dental Sciences

projects.name: OpenEMR â†’ Primary Care EHR: FHIR ETL Pipeline
projects.description: Engineered an end-to-end ETL migrating Patient, Condition, Observation, and Procedure resources from OpenEMR FHIR APIs, enforcing FHIR R4 compliance and referential integrity. Secured ingestion with bearer authentication; added request/response validation and idempotent upserts with structured error logging and retries. Normalized and enriched clinical data via SNOMED CT for concept resolution and bodySite mapping.

projects.name: Emergency Room Visit Analysis
projects.description: Built an ETL pipeline from OpenEMR clinical exports into a normalized MySQL schema enforcing primary/foreign key constraints. Engineered data cleaning and validation workflows to improve data integrity. Developed a fully rerunnable Jupyter analysis workflow combining SQL and Pandas joins to support population-level emergency-visit analytics.

projects.name: Assessing Risk Factors for Parkinson's Disease
projects.description: Built an end-to-end R workflow to investigate how clinical, cognitive, and lifestyle factors relate to Parkinson's diagnosis. Preprocessed and profiled data; conducted statistical testing and correlations; engineered features and visualized key patterns. Trained logistic regression and cluster-based models with rigorous evaluation.

projects.name: Stroke Risk Assessment with Machine Learning
projects.description: Prepared and cleaned a 40,000-row clinical dataset using SQL, standardizing key variables for stroke risk modeling. Developed and compared ML models in Python, identifying top predictors like hypertension and BMI, achieving 98% accuracy for targeted risk assessment.

certifications.name: Harnessing the Power of Data with Power BI
Preparing Data for Analysis with Microsoft Excel
